title: Dualities of Self-Dual Nonlinear Electrodynamics
authors: Jorge G. Russo and Paul K. Townsend
abstract:
For any causal nonlinear electrodynamics theory that is "self-dual"
(electromagnetic $U(1)$-duality invariant), the Legendre-dual pair of
Lagrangian and Hamiltonian densities $\{\mathcal{L},\mathcal{H}\}$ are
constructed from functions $\{\ell,h\}$ on ${\bf R}^+$ related to a
particle-mechanics Lagrangian and Hamiltonian. We show how a `duality' relating
$\ell$ to $h$ implies that $\mathcal{L}$ and $\mathcal{H}$ are related by a
simple map between appropriate pairs of variables. We also discuss Born's
"Legendre self-duality" and implications of a new "$\Phi$-parity" duality. Our
results are illustrated with many examples.
